intro: Pluchea amorifera, commonly known as the love-leaf or sweetleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
